model.physics

Class SimpleGeometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.physics.GeometryImpl
      • model.physics.SimpleGeometry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeometryInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GeometryReference

    public class SimpleGeometry
extends GeometryImpl
    SimpleGeometry alters the behavior of GeometyImpl by removing the doughnut optimizations. This often reduces the running time of the timeUntilRotating* methods, but will reduce accuracy unless a small maximumForesight is used. Most callers will not use SimpleGeometry directly, but will use the singleton Geometry instead.

    The doughnut optimizations are used by the timeUntilRotating* methods to narrow the possible times during which a collision might happen, in order to narrow the search space and improve accuracy.

    When dought optimizations are disabled, the timeUntilRotating* methods will always evaluate at least searchSlices data points between 0 and maximumForesight to search for a root. This will be faster for the cases where the doughnut calculations do not lead to a useful decrease in the time being searched, but will be slower for the cases where the doughnut optimizations would have deduced that no collision was possible.

    See Also:
    GeometryImpl, Geometry
